boardgame.name: Journeys with Jesus
boardgame.description: Journeys with Jesus is a route building game set in New Testament Israel. The goal of the game is complete the journeys that Jesus took as described in the gospel accounts. You complete a journey by collecting all of the towns and places along the route. Completing a journey earns points, and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

boardgame.name: A Tale of Two Captains
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pay attention, swabbies! Something new has sailed into the Sea of Thieves…

Being a pirate in the Sea of Thieves takes bravery, skill and a casual approach to death. But old pirates can get bored with the same routine: Find the ‘X’, kill the skellies, take the treasure and sell at the outpost. The last thing anyone wants is bored pirates, because that soon leads to fires, looting and cannonballs hitting below the waterline.

How do you avoid bored pirates? Give them new ways to be brave, skilful and dead. What pirate wouldn’t like that change?

A Tale of Two Captains is a supplement for the Sea of Thieves Roleplaying Game with a fleet’s worth of new rules, enemies, locations, NPCs and more. Now, a tabletop crew can sell Dark Relics, throw firebombs, explore the Molten Sands Fortress, ‘sink’ ghost ships and have even more proper piratin’ fun. Within are rules covering these video game updates:

Dark Relics
Smuggler’s Fortune
Fort of the Damned
Seabound Soul
Festival of Giving
Legends of the Sea
Crews of Rage
Heart of Fire
Ships of Fortune
Lost Treasures
Haunted Shores
Ashen Winds
Vaults of the Ancients
Plus two complete Voyages, Hunting the White Lady and Juliana’s Heart!


Fight glowing Shadows of Fate Skeletons to get a Treasure Vault. Fire chainshot at masts when your ship is atop a wave’s crest. Clear a skeleton fort and use the treasure to become an Emissary. And finally, get a proper pirate look with a parrot on your shoulder.

Are you ready for what the Sea of Thieves has to offer?

boardgame.name: Hunting the White Lady
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first new Voyage for the Sea of Thieves RPG!

Megalodons are giant sharks (emphasis on the giant) swimming in the deeps that occasionally come to the surface. They have existed for a long time in the Sea of Thieves but disappeared before a pirate named ‘Merry’ Merrick helped bring them back. He discovered a sea shanty and drum that, when played correctly, summoned the biggest Megalodon ever discovered up to that point: The Hungering One. Giant even for a Megalodon, its arrival in the Sea of Thieves brought back other Megalodons for good.

Some are just curious about ships sailing the Sea of Thieves, while others are territorial and will sink even galleons that dare sail through their waters. Even experienced pirates in the Sea of Thieves worry when they see a giant fin breaking the waves. Still, it is not like the Sea of Thieves is a safe place. Megalodons became just one more thing to worry about.

Lately, a Shrouded Ghost Megaldon has claimed the waters near Shipwreck Bay. A huge bounty has been placed upon the Megalodon; not only is that a lot of gold for a pirate, it is a proper pirate adventure! Some pirates are wary of battling a Shrouded Ghost Megalodon and (perhaps wisely) have stayed away, while others laugh and believe Shrouded Ghosts are only scary myths. But some will hunt The White Lady, their minds already ablaze with all the gold and glory this adventure will earn...

This ebook Voyage includes new rules for different types of Megladons and using Harpoons from your ship!

boardgame.name: Juliana's Heart
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new Voyage for the Sea of Thieves RPG!

Back in the wider world, Sea Dog vice-leader Amaranta was deeply in love with Lady Juliana, who was both beautiful and politically well-connected. Though Amaranta truly loved her there was also the benefit to having a royal in her bedchamber to consider. However, Juliana was lukewarm about the relationship at best.

She accidentally found her way into the Sea of Thieves, and quickly reunited with Amaranta. Lady Juliana knows nothing of piratin’, so to try and make their relationship stronger, Amaranta hires the players to train her so she can ultimately win a battle in the Arena and cement their love!

This ebook Voyage includes new rules for fighting in the Arena, dealing with modular damage on your ship, and coping with vicious waves!

boardgame.name: The Linear Men
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In Olympia, someone has opened a door.

Now the Outside comes screaming in this original scenario for Cthulhu Deep Green and Trophy Dark.

Guide your Agents to victory as they infiltrate Olympia’s underground music scene in search of three missing teens.

Then continue the fight in dream as Treasure Hunters on a quest for the Rebel Crown.

The Linear Men is a scenario in two acts. Designed for both CDG and Trophy Dark, it also contains rules and guidance on how to run incursions and investigations in either system.

Author's Notes

This material has a general content warning for depictions and allusions to violence and psychological manipulation.

Unlike similar games, CDG steps away from references to sanity and insanity but it does deal with stress related dysfunction and issues of work-life balance.

boardgame.name: Kingdom Rush: Elemental Uprising – Dark Elf Slayer Expansion
Kingdom Rush: Sturm der Elemente – Der dunkle Elf
boardgame.description:
Seek vengeance with new hero Reg’son as he hunts fearful boss Baj’nimen the Hateful in four new scenarios!

Inside the expansion, you’ll find the new Hero Reg’son, new Boss Baj’nimen the Hateful, both with gorgeous plastic miniatures. Baj’nimen stands at a whopping 80mm tall as he rides his giant centipede!

Across four scenarios you’ll encounter new mechanics including dragon Tower Mods, a new Miniboss the Twilight Brute, and Baj’nimen’s dreadful Rain of Dark Magic!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Flight Ace
boardgame.description: Collection of flight simulators. Released (for C64 and Amstrad) 1988.

boardgame.name: Grey Cells
boardgame.description:
(publisher blurb)

Grey Cells is a tabletop roleplaying game of detective fiction. Through choice or circumstance, your group of investigators are embroiled in criminal conspiracies that only they can stop. Faced with cunning villains and a ticking clock, will your wits and resources be enough to crack the case before it's too late?

boardgame.name: Mythos Mysteries
boardgame.description:
(publisher blurb)

Horrors wait upon the fringes of existence, lurking in the shadows beyond mortal comprehension. As investigators you bring light to the darkness - but how can you solve a case that is inherently unknowable? Mythos Mysteries introduces horror elements and mysteries to the Grey Cells role-playing game. Arm yourself with the new powers and techniques within... and hope that it is enough.

boardgame.name: Crimes in Chrome
boardgame.description:
(publisher blurb)

Crimes in Chrome expands upon the Grey Cells detective role-playing game, bringing investigators to the future. Times have changed. Society, technology and crime are constantly evolving, to the point where even what constitutes life itself is called into question. What role does justice have in this new world? What place will you carve out for yourself?

boardgame.name: Suspects and Sorcery
boardgame.description:
(publisher blurb)

Suspects and Sorcery expands the Grey Cells roleplaying game with the addition of fantasy elements, allowing Investigators to adopt the roles of questing knights and astute wizards fighting for justice in a world where anything is possible. Alongside mundane crime, the land is plagued by ancient curses and magical beasts that will require great cunning to face.

boardgame.name: Playing With Fire
boardgame.description:
A fun, fast paced, dice and card game of risk and chance where the highest scoring player wins the game. Players roll the dice in an attempt to score points on each roll in order to score a Blaze and earn bonus points. Special cards offer opportunity for additional challenges and surprises that can push you over the top, or you could get burnt and lose it all.
Suitable for in-person or virtual play for 2 or more players.
Optional betting and tournament rules offer additional fun and variety. Will you play it safe, or are you willing to play with fire in order to win?

boardgame.name: The Mouse, the Bird, & the Sausage
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Once upon a time a mouse, a bird, and a sausage formed a partnership.

They kept house together, and for a long time they lived in peace and prosperity, acquiring many possessions.

The bird's task was to fly into the forest every day to fetch wood.

The mouse carried water, made the fire, and set the table.

The sausage did the cooking.

Based on the classic Brothers Grimm story of the same name, The Mouse, the Bird, & the Sausage is a tabletop micro-rpg about fairy-tale creatures living together in dubious harmony.

boardgame.description: Completely created (handwritten and drawn) by a 12 year old, this fanzine contains a scenario and supplementary materials for DSA, reviews and a puzzle.

boardgame.name: Bleakbarrow's Broken Bridge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A broken bridge spans this misty, seemingly bottomless, pit. Giant cobwebs cling to its underside, as well as coat the surrounding edges of the gorge; waiting for those who slip or wander foolishly into their grasp.
Dying trees cover the surrounding cliffs, with sparse undergrowth that crunches underfoot. Fallen rocks litter the narrow walkways, while you can hear strange clicking noises echoing up from the seemingly bottomless caverns.
Mist hangs over the area, and it is strangely absent of birdsong. You only notice one or two fluttering between the trees, and they seem on high alert.

Adventure Seed

You’ve been paid by a worried father to find his missing son. He accepted a challenge with the other men to race to the nearest town to collect a token for a lady. Whoever collected it and returned it to her first would win her hand in marriage, as well as a considerable inheritance.
The problem is, this was days ago and all the other men are already back, without the package. He suspects his foolhardy son took a dangerous shortcut through the mountains, known as Bleakbarrow’s Bridge. No-one knows what’s up there, only that those who wander through it never return. He wants you to recover his son and bring him home safely. Or his body, so that he may give him the burial rites he deserves.
WHAT’S HAPPENING? The man’s son, being of a rather thin build, planned to outwit his brawny opponents by taking the shortcut through the mountains. This would have been a good idea if his belief that the other villagers were overly superstitious were actually valid.
While he made the first crossing safely at daytime and managed to collect the package from the far village, unfortunately for him his second crossing was at dusk. While he attempted to return via the broken bridge, the giant spiders who were nesting beneath it ambushed him.
Luckily for him, he can still be saved. He is paralysed and cocooned within the lair of the spiders, but still alive. For now. Unfortunately for you, however, the package dropped off him and fell deeper into the lair. Should you cut him loose, he begs you to try find it.
If you follow him you’ll find lots of loot on the dead bodies, as well as spider eggs which start hatching at the disturbance. Should the man be returned to the village safely with the package he’ll claim the lady’s hand in marriage—they did, after all, plan the challenge for his success, so he could finally win acceptance from her disapproving father.

boardgame.name: Bleakbarrow's Bridge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A broken bridge spans this misty, seemingly bottomless, pit. Giant cobwebs cling to its underside, as well as coat the surrounding edges of the gorge; waiting for those who slip or wander foolishly into their grasp.
Dying trees cover the surrounding cliffs, with sparse undergrowth that crunches underfoot. Fallen rocks litter the narrow walkways, while you can hear strange clicking noises echoing up from the seemingly bottomless caverns.
Mist hangs over the area, and it is strangely absent of birdsong. You only notice one or two fluttering between the trees, and they seem on high alert.
If you need to cross to the other side, pray nothing notices you.

boardgame.name: Spider's Gorge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Giant cobwebs of differing sizes span the gaps of this misty gorge. Their sticky strands cling to the crumbling stone, waiting under bridges and fallen trees for those who slip or wander foolishly into their grasp.
Dying trees cover the surrounding cliffs, with sparse undergrowth that crunches underfoot. Fallen rocks litter the narrow walkways, while you can hear strange clicking noises echoing up from the seemingly bottomless caverns.
Mist hangs over the area, and it is strangely absent of birdsong. You only notice one or two fluttering between the trees, and they seem on high alert.

boardgame.name: Broken Underdark Bridge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A stone bridge spans this misty, seemingly bottomless, underdark pit. Giant cobwebs cling to its underside, as well as coat the surrounding edges of the gorge; waiting for those who slip or wander foolishly into their grasp.
The surrounding cliffs are bare, crumbling stone. Fallen rocks litter the narrow walkways, while you can hear strange clicking noises echoing up from the seemingly bottomless caverns.
If you need to cross to the other side, pray nothing notices you.

boardgame.name: Underdark Spider's Bridge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A stone bridge spans this misty, seemingly bottomless, underdark pit. Giant cobwebs cling to its underside, as well as coat the surrounding edges of the gorge; waiting for those who slip or wander foolishly into their grasp.
The surrounding cliffs are bare, crumbling stone. Fallen rocks litter the narrow walkways, while you can hear strange clicking noises echoing up from the seemingly bottomless caverns.
If you need to cross to the other side, pray nothing notices you.

boardgame.name: A Grave Situation
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A mysterious creature has moved into the town cemetery and murders anyone who dares enter its new hunting grounds. Eyewitness reports say the monster looks like some sort of golem but crafted from tombstones and mossy grave markers. The PCs have been hired to clear out this threat, or perhaps have simply stumbled upon this creature while strolling past a cemetery minding their own business.

boardgame.name: Elves of Alamansthara
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Elves of Alamansthara are quite unlike the Dwarves you are used to. If you're sick and tired of your usual Elves, or looking to dive deeper inot the Dragonoxcide campaign, look no further.

boardgame.name: Enhanced Skills and Tools
Proficiencies in Alamansthara
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sick of Common? Wish you could have the intrigue of subtle shifts in language and accent in your campaign setting? Wish that half of those Tool Proficiency like tinkering and alchemy actually did something? Wish you could play a famous artist whose works garnered fame throughout the world. What about a sports star who used their gift athletics to bring peace and bridge the gap between warring cultures? Or even a skateboarder who uses their knowledge of movement to quickly navigate the streets of the massive city they live in. Interested in the very first Dragonoxcide supplement that is brimming with hints and previews of the awesome epicness that is yet to come? Well then, maybe this supplement is worth picking up.

boardgame.name: 5D RPG Quick Play
5DRPG Quick Play
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

5D RPG is a narrative oriented action RPG designed to emulate popular video games, anime, books, movies, and more. Characters are easy to create and easy update. The rules are narrative oriented and combat is merely one option among many. With deep social interactions and an advanced stealth and investigation magic. 5D RPG is the latest version of an RPG with over two decades of development.

boardgame.name: グッドプライス！ (Good Price!)
boardgame.description:
グッドプライス！ (Good Price!) is a communication game from Japan. Players are business planners trying to bring together new products to sell on a TV shopping network. They must keep the products in a price range, and get them approved by the company chairperson.

The game has a deck of 52 Material cards, each quartile shows a product type, such as fish, futon, suit, song, curry.

The other decks have a variety of price info, from 100s to millions of Yen. There are numbered cards for voting and ranking cards, #1 marked as 'Chairman'.

The game has paper and pencils so players can write out their ideas. Once the products have been discussed, players vote on them, and the winning ideas get scoring chips.
user summary

boardgame.name: Spank the Monkey (Second Edition)
boardgame.description:
Spank the Monkey is a fast-paced, humorous card game with sneaky tactics. All players are working in a junk yard where a teasing monkey has appeared. Your job is to climb up to the monkey and spank it.

There are 5 types of cards in the game. Junk cards, like the totem pole, surfboard, and garden gnome, are used to pile on top of each other and form the "board" in front of each player. Each junk card has its own height, strength, and often a special ability when played. The combined height of your junk cards is used to see if you have reached the monkey. Some junk cards are a bit fragile, but they can be strengthened by reinforcement cards like duct tape, ivy, and a hired security guard. Each junk card also belongs to at least one category of which there are 7 in the game.

During the game, you attack the junk card of other players in an attempt to make them fall down, or at least lower them a bit. There are three kind of attacks; throwing attacks (bowling ball, flock of seagulls, and dynamite) that you can use on any junk card, hand attacks (chainsaw, blind, and crowbar) that you can only use on cards at the same height as yourself, and the sneak attacks (lawyer, wasp’s nest, and ball cannon) that all have special abilities.

A die roll is used to solve the attack. You add the attack value of your attack card and compare it to the combined strength of the attacked junk card and any reinforcement cards it might have. The defending player may play defense cards that either lower the die roll (umbrella, satellite dish, and wok) or completely stop or redirect the attack (electric force field, tennis racket, and trampoline).

If a junk card is destroyed, you have effectively lowered that player's height by the height of the card, and if there are junk cards above the destroyed card, they fall down, and the defender is forced to make a collision roll to see if the junk cards also are destroyed.

The fifth card type is called special, and it is a kind of catchall for all the crazy special effect you may do in the game. There are all kinds of tricks, like giving you an extra turn, starting an earthquake, and having a police raid.

NOTE: The expansion Monkey Business has been included in the base game since 2007.

listing.notes:

boardgame.name: Rycerze okrągłego sera
boardgame.description:
Rycerze okrągłego sera is a dynamic, two-player card game set in the world of the web comic Fox Matters by Beata Smugaj. During gameplay, participants will create their own teams of fluffers by recruiting foxes from the market and resolving their effects. Each successive card selected will not only affect the course of the game, but also the way points are scored at the end of the game.

The goal of the game is to get the most profitable combination of fox cards that will bring the most points at the end of the game. To do this, players will take their turns. In his turn, a player:

Buys a fox card from the queue (the cost of each card depends on its place in the row).
Resolves the ability of the purchased card.
Places the purchased card face up in his team.
Shifts the cards in the queue to the left.
Draws as many cards from the deck as there are empty spaces in the queue (usually 1).
Replenishes the queue with any cards from your hand.


In this way we act until the deck is exhausted. The player with the most points wins. In case of a tie, the other player wins.


Lisi król i jego puchaterowie wyruszają na walkę z koszmarami. W tym czasie mieszkańcy lisiego królestwa, Foxenfurtu, postanawiają stworzyć zastępcze drużyny puchaterów.

Rycerze okrągłego sera to dynamiczna, dwuosobowa gra karciana osadzona w świecie internetowego komiksu "Lisie Sprawy" autorstwa Beaty Smugaj. Podczas rozgrywki uczestnicy będą tworzyli własne drużyny puchaterów poprzez rekrutowanie lisków z kolejki i rozpatrywanie ich efektów. Każda kolejna dobrana karta będzie wpływała nie tylko na przebieg zabawy, ale również na sposób punktowania na koniec gry.

Celem gry jest zdobycie najbardziej opłacalnej kombinacji kart lisków, która przyniesie jak najwięcej punktów na koniec gry. W tym celu gracze będą kolejno rozgrywali swoje tury. W swojej turze gracz:

Kupuje kartę lisa z kolejki (koszt każdej karty jest zależny od jej miejsca w szeregu).
Rozpatruje zdolność kupionej karty.
Kupioną kartę umieszcza odkrytą w swojej drużynie.
Przesuwa karty w kolejce w lewą stronę.
Dobiera na rękę tyle kart z talii, ile jest pustych miejsc w kolejce (zazwyczaj 1).
Uzupełnia kolejkę dowolnymi kartami z ręki.


W ten sposób działamy aż do wyczerpania talii. Gracz z największą liczbą punktów wygrywa. W przypadku remisu wygrywa drugi gracz.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Oceans: Food Bags
boardgame.description:
Cloth drawstring bags with the Oceans game logo silk screened on one side and Oceans related creature art on the other side. These are meant to be used to store food/fish eaten/taken over the course of the game.

Kickstarter Exclusive.

boardgame.name: Mixing It Up with the Mob Map Pack
boardgame.description:
From the description:

These are the maps from the Dare-Luck Club starting adventure, "Mixing It up with the Mob" (found in the back of the main rule book). They include the Gudrun Community Library maps, the randomized sewer pieces (as well as the start and end points), and the McCormmick's barn maps. These are laid out to be color-printed on 11 x 17 paper.

boardgame.name: 舞妓ジャングル (Maiko Jungle)
boardgame.description:
This is an irregular sugoroku game for two players who are trying to get to the goal before their opponents in Kyoto, which has suddenly turned into a jungle.

It's sugoroku, but without dice.

When you move forward, you reveal all of your cards to your opponent. If the cards in your hand meet the requirements of the next square (e.g., you have a "5" in your hand, two red cards, etc.), you can advance to the next square.

If you can create a hand that can meet the conditions of multiple squares, you can advance to several squares at once in one turn.
It's hard to decide whether you should have all the cards in your hand and move forward at once or chop them up into small pieces.

Since the sugoroku squares are cards, the board changes every time you play, and the best way to make the best hand changes every time, so you can play with a fresh mind as often as you like.

In addition, each card is a real-life jungle of tourist attractions in Kyoto (Kyoto Tower, Fushimi Inari Taisha Shrine, etc.).
It is also fun to see the beautiful maiko pieces you use strutting around the exotic Kyoto.

The game takes about 15 minutes per game, and is a game for two players that can be played easily while worrying.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.description:
As the director of a winter sport called "Snow Smash", you lead three clan members to compete against rival teams.

Players use two actions, "Step" and "Smash", to move around the field, which becomes narrower with time, and send snowballs to predict the whereabouts of opponents hiding somewhere in the same field.

If the snowball hits, you get points!
Use the unique smash gadgets called "Arum" to get more points than your rivals!

boardgame.description: Play Mat made available during the game's kickstarter. Neoprene Mat with areas for Draw pile, Discard Pile, and Points pile.

boardgame.name: Pass the Deck: A party starting drinking game
Pass the Deck: America's Pre-Funk Card Game
boardgame.description:
Pass the Deck is a fun party-starting, friend-making, villain creating drinking game.
How to Play: Players compete in various mini-games like "naming Disney movies" and "having a strip off". The goal of the game is to be the first person to win 3 Golden Beer cards.

Unique Game Play: Secret Cards are kept secret until someone unknowingly completes the action on the card ("Next person to use the restroom drinks"), and Rule Cards which force you to do something ("Grab drinks for anyone that needs one until the end of the game").

Includes 112 unique cards, 13 blank cards for your own hilarious ideas, and a koozie for the winner (to remind the others who the ? is).

Perfect for tailgating, college parties, 21 runs, bachelor/bachelorette parties, camping, pre-funking / pre-gaming, white elephant / secret Santa gift for those that love drinking games.

boardgame.name: Everyone's a Critic: A game of drawing sketchy things
boardgame.description:
Everyone’s A Critic is a fun adult drawing game that brings artists and amateurs together to compete for the most hilarious drawing.
HOW TO PLAY: Players take turns as “The Critic”. The Critic draws a card and reads it out loud. The other players have 60 seconds to draw the best image that comes to mind. The first player to win three rounds wins it all. Players: 3 - 10+ | Time: 30 - 90 min | Ages: 17+
Some of the drawings will be lighthearted like draw your spirit animal, others will be sketchy (pun intended) like draw the person most likely to fart during sex.


There are five card types: Draw This, Questions, Eyes Closed, Speed Round, and Wild Cards.

The game includes 170 sketchy drawing prompts, 10 blank cards for your own ridiculous ideas, 10 draw pads, 10 pencils, a sand timer, and a pair of very stylish glasses?


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hakuoki: Reimeiroku
Hakuoki: Reimeiroku Nagorigusa
Hakuoki: Reimeiroku – Omouhase Kara
薄桜鬼 黎明録
薄桜鬼 黎明録 名残り草
薄桜鬼 黎明録 思馳せ空
boardgame.description: The prequel focuses on a young man named Ryunosuke Ibuki, who is saved by the leader of Roshigumi (the old name of Shinsengumi), Kamo Serizawa, and then forced to join Roshigumi as his page to repay his debt. Similar to the original game, it is consisted of six routes of the same characters where Ibuki is required to make the right choice to form friendship with each main characters of their respective routes. In all routes, Ibuki always ends up leaving the Shinsengumi to start a new life of his own. Reaching the good ending of the routes would show the continuation of the ending of respective Shinsengumi members with Chizuru from the original game after war ends.

boardgame.name: 1822 Scotland Medium Regional and North Regional scenario board set
boardgame.description:
This is an reduced map used for the 1822: Railways of Great Britain game, which is part of the 18xx series based on the growth of the Railways through the age of steam. It is the northern part of the 1822 map, that is Birmingham and northwards, with Wales and London as off board locatons.

Players take the part of investors in Railway companies and then operate the companies to maximise their own wealth.

The basic rules of 1822 is used with just some small changes. The setup is different, removing some privates, minors, majors and tiles, which results in a slightly shorter game.

Privates used in 1822NRS: P1-P21, except P5, P10, P17

Minors used in 1822NRS: 1-10, 15, 16, 26-29

Majors removed from 1822NRS: GWR, LBSCR, SECR, and SWR

The rules are available on the publisher's site.

boardgame.name: Three Days of Glory 1805
Trois Jours de Gloire 1805
boardgame.description:
Trois Jours de Gloire 1805 (Three Days of Glory 1805) combines three battles of the German and Austrian campaigns of 1805, already published in the Jours de Gloire (Days of Glory) series, in a revised and redesigned edition.


Elchingen, 14 October 1805

Austerlitz, 2 December 1805


Game components

Scale

• Units 1 strength point equals 200 infantry, 150 cavalry, 2 or 4 cannons

boardgame.name: Vengeance of the Gods
boardgame.description:
The world burns with divine wrath in a new sacred war. Test your mettle in Vengeance of the Gods, where modern warfare meets the power of the ancient gods in a challenging area control strategy wargame. Choose one of 12 ancient deities to worship, each one granting unique and powerful abilities. Master the skies with the might of Zeus or fool your enemy with one of Loki's mischievous tricks. With the gods on your side, it's a race against other players for territory and resources and you fight to rule the world. Will you dominate your enemies and prove you divine right or will you fall before the might of other deities?

Theme:
Modern warfare with ancient gods.

Game-play:
Each player builds a modern army (soldiers, artillery, tanks, planes) while also worshipping an ancient god. When the gods are happy they grant players powerful abilities to help them wage war.

Battles are conducted using dice. The game comes with 30 dice so large battles are conducted quickly.

Goal:
Each player starts the game with a town. For short games (60-120mins) the first player to take control of 3 towns wins.

For longer conquest game (120-180mins) the first player to control 4 continents wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Jackals: Bronze Age Fantasy Roleplaying
boardgame.description:
The Zaharets, the land between the Vori Wastes and the Plains of Aeco, is well-known as the Land of Risings. Dominated by the rising city-states of Ameena Noani and Sentem, facing each other along the great War Road, the Zaharets has always been home to powerful civilizations. Beastmen ruins dot the landscape, a constant reminder of the Kingdom of Sin and the fragility of the Law of Men. Even older are the great ruins of the Hulathi, the legendary sea peoples, and the Hannic mansions sealed beneath the mountains, awaiting those who would seek out the Lost Folk. Scars abound from the wars between ruined Keta in the north and Gerwa in the south. And, far to the east, the legends of Muadah still beckon occultists and Jackals who seek to plunder its corrupted ruins.

Inspired by the myths, cultures, and history of the Ancient Near East, and by such ancient texts as the Iliad, the Epic of Gilgamesh, and the Old Testament, Jackals is a Sword & Sorcery roleplaying game set in a Fantasy Bronze Age. With mechanics based on the popular OpenQuest system, the game places players in the role of Jackals - adventurers, explorers, sellswords, and scavengers - and sends them out into the peril-filled land of the Zaharets to make their fortune… or perhaps fulfill a greater destiny…

boardgame.name: Calling of the Matriarch
boardgame.description:
"Calling of the Matriarch" is a premium print-and-play, narrative-focused, fully cooperative 1-4 Players Role-Playing Adventure Board Game.

The game takes place in a grimmer aspect of the fantasy world Spheria, as you create a character and assume the role of an adventurer trying to survive an outbreak of monsters in the once-thriving city of the Kingdom.

You, "The Sojourner", takes refuge with the city's survivors in a haven known as "The Lith", guided by a mysterious figure known as The Matriarch, you go on dangerous quests into the monster-ridden city, alone, or together with your ally, to overcome challenges that may bring you closer to you and the other's ultimate survival, and at the same time, seek the truth of the event by acquiring information and hints throughout your many quests.

Inspired by role-playing games and dungeon crawl games of deep storytelling, adventure, and dynamic combat, as well as skirmish games with miniatures, "Calling of the Matriarch" is both a solo and cooperative game with no need of any adversary players. You may venture into the danger as a lone adventurer to create their own legend, or together with their ally, carve their way through many events and dangers to reveal the hidden truth behind the crisis.

boardgame.name: シャオパイロン (Xiao Pylon)
小白龍 (Small White Dragon)
boardgame.description:
シャオパイロン (Xiao Pylon) 小白龍 (Small White Dragon) is a game from Japan with players trying to collect scales from a dragon by entertainment.

The dragon starts in the middle of the chequered board and the players' tokens set up near the dragon. Players then use hand cards to see who moves, and try to get their token next to the dragon to collect scale tokens. Then a card is turned up to move the dragon. The board is wrap around, and the dragon can move diagonally, but not onto a player.

The game uses a butting mechanism. Players chose a card in secret, reveal together, and when cards are matched, those players cancel each other out. The highest clear number wins, but players also have fan cards. If a high number wins, a fan card can also move. But if multiple fan cards are played, they also cancel each other.

After 6 rounds, the player with the most scales is the winner.

The game includes rules for 2 players.
user summary

The publisher says:
An old story. The scales of the White Dragon were very beautiful and highly prized. However, it is said that anything that touches the body of the White Dragon will be cursed and unhappy. You have found the temple where the White Dragon lives. A small white dragon lived in the temple. Then Hakuryu spoke to me. "Do you want scales? If so, entertain me. By the way, scales are swelling. Who is the most daring and lucky one in the swelling? Then, the color of your eyes changed and the battle for scales began. Who can get the most scales?

The simple rule is that the person who collects the scales and wins the most in all 6 rounds, but the card selection for each round is very troublesome, and the tricky moving small white dragon determines the outcome of the game. An unusual card butting game that uses square boards and pieces.
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Crazy Cultists: The Dark Powers Expansion

You wanted dark powers...and now you got 'em! Or at least you CAN get them. Earn the Dark One's favor to be granted powerful new abilities in the form of Dark Powers Cards and start wreakin' some freakin' havoc!

boardgame.name: Anachrony: Update Pack

2x Dual-sided Path Boards (Progress and Salvation)
4x2 Leader cards

The Update Pack is for the Base Box edition of Anachrony (Leader or Follower Box). If you have the Essential Edition, the Anachrony Infinity Box, or the Infinity Upgrade Pack, you already own the components of this Update Pack.

boardgame.name: iDOL ST@GE BATTLE 765基本セット
boardgame.description:
Form a unit of three up and coming idols from 765 Production and aim to have as many fans as possible by the time the final stage comes around. Form a deeper bond with your unit as a producer by winning stages and completing jobs. Luck is important in this competitive industry. Stage and job cards require stat check rolls according to the affection of your idols. If you succeed, they are added to your deck and often raise your idols' affection. When their affection reaches its maximum level they become awakened, upgrading to more powerful stats and effects.

Winning stages is a battle between producers attempting to have the most appeal. In turn order, players select one of three stages they would like to participate in for the round. From left to right the stages are resolved, allowing players to play as many cards with the appeal keyword as possible from their hand to gain appeal according to their idols stats. The winner gains affection and fans, while the loser may suffer penalties. The player with the most fans by the end of the game is the winner.

boardgame.name: Factum
boardgame.description: You get to tell real stories of your life and connect them with cards illustrating different plots. Players are dealt five cards each. Then a volunteer tells a story of their life and associates it with a card. They players are divided into two teams, with different members in each turn. Players from one team put one of their cards to match the story told as much as possible, trying to confuse the players from another team, who are trying to guess which card the storyteller has put.

boardgame.name: MLB The Show 21
boardgame.description:
User Summary

MLB The Show 21 is the 16th entry in the officially licensed baseball series. The game features all 30 major league teams and their full roster of players. Also included are each team's minor league affiliate teams at the AA and AAA level. There are a number of playstyle and difficulty options that allow players to customize the experience, ranging from pick up and play to competitive and simulation modes. The game also offers a dynamic difficulty setting that tailors the game's challenge level based on the player's performance in each phase of the game. Pitching, batting, and fielding each have independent difficulty settings, and players can choose from multiple control scheme options.

This version of the show includes the classic exhibition, franchise, and Road to the Show career mode in previous entries while also adding an overhauled version of Diamond Dynasty mode. Players earn experience points and in-game currency in every mode, allowing them to purchase card packs to improve their Diamond Dynasty team or their Road to the Show player's stats and abilities. New to the game is the ballpark creator mode, allowing players to design and create their own stadiums from scratch as well as edit the scenery, ballpark dimensions, wall height, and foul territory in existing parks. Players can also download other user created parks using the in-game community system.

Matt Vasgersian, Mark DeRosa, Dan Plesac, and Heidi Watney all reprise their roles as in-game commentators and analysts. The game offers multiple presentation modes ranging from an "on the field" experience to a TV broadcast mode. For the first time in the series' history, the game was released on Xbox consoles, and there is cross platform compatibility between the PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5 versions.

boardgame.name: Gloom: Grief Case
boardgame.description:
The luxurious Grief Case is large enough to hold every Gloom game produced thus far — that’s roughly 1500 Gloom cards — plus all your rules and extras, and your darkest secrets. (It’s even got room to accommodate another four full Gloom games or eight expansions, for when you add future Gloom games to your collection.)

This case is extremely sturdy! 4mm thick laminated chipboard will make this the strongest game box in your collection, sure to hold up to a lifetime of use. Or, of course, 'til Untimely Death.

Soft Touch finish adds a luxurious velvety-soft texture for instant tactile appeal and resistance to fingerprint marks. It also makes sliding the lid off the box both quick and satisfying.

Spot gloss and red metallic foil add texture and shine to highlight design elements.

This deluxe box comes with its own thick acrylic dividers, so you can sort and cross-reference your games and cards in whatever way makes the most sense to you.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Nusubito
boardgame.description:
Nusubito is a two player hidden movement game in which one player will take on the role of the Thief; a ninja-like character leaping across temple rooftops in search of a hidden treasure. The other player will control the Mists, spirits who guard the temple complex.

The game is played over a series of Day and Night cycles, with three rounds per day, and one round per night.

During the day, the Thief will be secretly leaping from temple to temple looking for clues about the hidden treasure’s whereabouts, whilst the Mists spread across the board in search of the intruder!

During the night, each side will get the chance to gather resources.

Play ends when either the Thief finds the Treasure, or the Mists capture the Thief!

boardgame.name: Assassination in Sarajevo
boardgame.description:
A game based on the event that sparked the First World War, the assassination of the heir to the Austro-Hungarian throne, Franz Ferdinand, and his wife, Sofie. Utilizing die-roll and random-chit mechanics, it is designed for solitaire play but has rules for 2 players.

The game consists of two parts. In Part 1, "Assassination," the player tries to prevent the assassination or wounding of the royal couple by members of the Black Hand Serbian separatist group. In the 2-player version, one player takes the role of the Black Hand.

In Part 2, "July Crisis," the solitaire player tries to prevent the incident from starting a war; in the 2-player, one player is the peace faction, the other the war faction. The odds for peace are improved if the royal couple survived in Part 1, but that does not guarantee the "powder keg of Europe" won't explode.

This game originally appeared in World War One Illustrated magazine No. 2 and does not include the 13 six-sided dice necessary for play. Two-player rules that were not in the magazine are included in the stand-alone game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: On to Paris!
boardgame.description:
A solitaire game of the German drive on Paris in 1914, played in six turns representing the time period August 27–28 through September 6–7. The player operates the German forces and has three possible victory conditions based on army strength and unit location on the playing area at the end of the sixth turn.

German army corps move across rows of rectangles overlaid on a partial map of France (Arras to the outskirts of Paris). When German and Entente units occupy the same row of rectangles combat occurs. The player rolls 1d6 for every 2 German corps in the rectangle and adds the total result to the strength of the corps, then does the same for the Entente player. There are modifiers based on map location. Loser must retreat one row or reduce the strength of one corps. Random events may send German corps off to East Prussia or to sieges of Channel ports or Low Country towns. Other events may bring reinforcements to either side, advance the Germans’ Schlieffen Plan, result in Entente confusion or German exhaustion, etc.

This game originally appeared in World War One Illustrated magazine No. 3 and does not include the six-sided dice necessary for play. Two-player rules that were not in the magazine are included in the stand-alone game.

—user summary

boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Avignon: A Clash of Popes – The Heretic Promo

boardgame.name: Connections
boardgame.description:
Based on the Granada/ITV game show that ran from 1985-1990, in which players score points by by answering general knowledge questions and make connections from letters, numbers and picture clues.

The game is divided into six rounds: Connect the Clue, Link the Letter, Find the Figure, Link the Letter, Find the Clue, and Connect the Clue.

Connect the Clue involves answering questions and figuring out the connection between the picture clues that go with them.

Link the Letter involves answering seven questions, with the first letter of each answer being placed on the board. Players win the round by unscrambling those letters and coming up with the correct word.

Find the Figure involves solving a long math equation. Again, players answer questions, with parts of the equation being placed after each answer. The first player to solve the equation wins the round.

Scoring for each round is 10 points per correct answer, and a bonus of 100 points for making the connection, except in the final round, where it’s 20 points per answer and 200 bonus points for making the connection. The player with the highest score after six rounds wins.

listing.notes: Complete. Showing wear commensurate with age.

boardgame.name: Growing Season
boardgame.description:
Growing Season is a two-player board game inspired by resource management video games where the player runs a farm; such as the Harvest Moon saga, or the popular indie game Stardew Valley.

Growing Season is an accessible and straightforward game that mixes deck building and resource management. It serves as a perfect introduction to more complex board games, or as a perfect game for quick games on the couch, it doesn't require much preparation but hides a lot of depth in the optimization of the hands and resources.

A normal game of Growing Season lasts about 35 minutes, during which players will build and grow their farms. Players will start with three plots of land and not much more than the efforts of their farmers, and by the end of the game they will run a huge and automated farm, with which they'll be able to tackle the most complicated and lucrative crops, using sprinklers, a harvester, and with several barns.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Russia's Great War: 1914
boardgame.description:
A seven-turn game based on Russia’s invasion of East Prussia from August 17–18 through August 29–30. The Russian player wins by eliminating three German corps or by having three corps in the western end of the Western box (i.e., west of the Vistula River) and at least one corps in the other four boxes of the area-movement map. The German player’s victory requires eliminating three Russian corps and preventing any Russian units from being in the western half of the Western box.

The five movement boxes are overlaid on a map of East Prussia and a portion of the Russian Empire. Each is divided into two parts, distinguished by brown in one half and yellow in the other. Opposing units may occupy the same box without being in the same area, in which case combat is not mandatory unless the German side plays the German Reckless Advance marker. When battle occurs in the Broken Terrain of the two southern boxes each side rolls a die to limit the number of enemy corps that can participate and might further mess with an opponent by playing a Confusion marker. Other Combat and Random

Event markers include Air Recon, Cautious Advance/Pursuit, Cavalry Raid, etc. Restrictions and opportunities also arise based on individual game turns and what happened historically on the days those turns represent. A sidebar describes the historical events. (The game won an award in the Educational Board Game category at the 2019 Serious Play Conference.)

Designed to be a solitaire game published in a magazine, the stand-alone version comes with two-player rules as well. Players have to supply their own six-sided dice.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Obachan Panic!
boardgame.description:
OBACHAN PANIC is a roleplaying game where neurotic grandmas & aunties save the world—and look good doing it!
Everyone has one: a wonderfully quirky, slightly naggy grandma (or aunty). But little did you know that they saved your home and country countless times from alien invasions, government conspiracies, untold monsters, the singularity, economic collapse and deflated soufflés—AND made it home in time to make you that casserole you like.

Beloved by tabletop designers and celebs and featured by Kickstarter as one of the hits of Zinequest #1, Obachan Panic! is MONSTER OF THE WEEK x MONSTERHEARTS, but with adorable grannies and aunties, wrapped in neuroses and served with a side of chicken soup and weaponized guilt.


Simple storygame rules (family=17185)
Arts & craft character creations - comes with standees you can cut and color!
Lots of "Build your own obachan" random tables - including what's in your purse!
Act out by triggering your inner obachan (ie. why you never call? unmarried young people!) and use your neuroses to activate your OBACHAN SUPERPOWERS (ie. thousand yard death stare, summoning Marie Kondo)
Gossip mechanic that helps give newer players a way to help craft the story


Source: The Publisher Website.
